parseGBIF 0.0.1
  • Reference

    select_gbif_fields

    select_gbif_fields.Rd

    Select columns in GBIF occurrence data

    select_gbif_fields(columns = "standard")

    Arguments

    columns

    'standard' basic columns about what, when, where, and who collected, 'all' all available columns or list column names

    Value

    list of the columns names

    Details

    "standard" : indicated by (standard)

    or

    'all':

    • 'gbifID'

    • 'abstract'

    • 'accessRights'

    • 'accrualMethod'

    • 'accrualPeriodicity'

    • 'accrualPolicy'

    • 'alternative'

    • 'audience'

    • 'available'

    • 'bibliographicCitation' (standard)

    • 'conformsTo'

    • 'contributor'

    • 'coverage'

    • 'created'

    • 'creator'

    • 'date'

    • 'dateAccepted'

    • 'dateCopyrighted'

    • 'dateSubmitted'

    • 'description'

    • 'educationLevel'

    • 'extent'

    • 'format'

    • 'hasFormat'

    • 'hasPart'

    • 'hasVersion'

    • 'identifier'

    • 'instructionalMethod'

    • 'isFormatOf'

    • 'isPartOf'

    • 'isReferencedBy'

    • 'isReplacedBy'

    • 'isRequiredBy'

    • 'isVersionOf'

    • 'issued'

    • 'language' (standard)

    • 'license'

    • 'mediator'

    • 'medium'

    Examples

    # \donttest{
# select_gbif_fields()

help(select_gbif_fields)
#> Help on topic 'select_gbif_fields' was found in the following packages:
#> 
#>   Package               Library
#>   ParsGBIF              C:/Users/Pablo
#>                       Hendrigo/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3
#>   parseGBIF             C:/Users/Pablo
#>                       Hendrigo/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpsFfGNV/temp_libpath5178233ad4e
#> 
#> 
#> Using the first match ...

col_sel <- select_gbif_fields(columns = 'all')

col_sel <- select_gbif_fields(columns = 'standard')
# }
